channel.title: Quest tab: sizes and colors. [PI]
channel.description:
Hey, I was wondering how I would be able to change the size and color of this:
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/2w69ock.jpg[/img]
I know how to move things around, but the size and color seem to be set.
Also, how would I remove the "Free Quests" part?

item.title: Quest tab: sizes and colors. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“I am beast, post:5, topic:439084”]I checked for both of those.

Check around in your client. You should see things such as this somewhere in your client class within this method:

private int getColorByName(String s) {

Those should tell you how to change the color.

This just gave me a list of what colors equate to what color code, not a list of strings.

[quote author=Skiire link=topic=541787.msg3968976#msg3968976 date=1333994959]
In order to override the Free Quests part:

sendFrame126("", 663-638);

I’m not sure which Id it is… I used Lin’s Interface Editor to modify it.[/quote]

I did this, and overrided it, (so I thought), but nothing changed.[/quote]

You should see something like this:

if (s.equals("cya"))
	return 65535;

Use @cya@ within the server whenever you’re sending your strings and well-ah.

Just change it through the cache then. Load up Lin’s interface editor open interface 638 and go to free quests and manually change the input that string is sending.

Read full topic

item.title: Quest tab: sizes and colors. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

I checked for both of those.

[quote=“Skiire, post:4, topic:439084”]Check around in your client. You should see things such as this somewhere in your client class within this method:

private int getColorByName(String s) {

Those should tell you how to change the color.[/quote]

This just gave me a list of what colors equate to what color code, not a list of strings.

[quote=“Skiire, post:4, topic:439084”]In order to override the Free Quests part:

sendFrame126("", 663-638);

I’m not sure which Id it is… I used Lin’s Interface Editor to modify it.[/quote]

I did this, and overrided it, (so I thought), but nothing changed.

Read full topic

item.title: Quest tab: sizes and colors. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“I am beast, post:1, topic:439084”]Hey, I was wondering how I would be able to change the size and color of this:

I know how to move things around, but the size and color seem to be set.

Also, how would I remove the “Free Quests” part?[/quote]

Check around in your client. You should see things such as this somewhere in your client class within this method:

private int getColorByName(String s) {

Those should tell you how to change the color.

In order to override the Free Quests part:

sendFrame126("", 663-638);

I’m not sure which Id it is… I used Lin’s Interface Editor to modify it.

Read full topic

item.title: Quest tab: sizes and colors. [PI]
item.dc:creator: @dzeko dzeko
item.description:
@dzeko wrote:

open Client.java from your sources.
search for public void process()
right under this, u’ll see your quest tab text…
to edit colours, use “@red@, @blu@, @bla@, etc.” before your text

Read full topic
